title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. what: WeibullR.learnr: An Interactive Introduction to Life Data Analysis
title: NA
text: Welcome WeibullR.learnr! package contains set interactive learning modules life data analysis, focusing reliability, availability, maintainability (RAM). designed beginners, including university students early-career professionals.

title: NA
text: Life data analysis study things function time, machines people. Although many learning resources exist, reference proprietary software, may expensive inaccessible students new field. WeibullR.learnr open-source alternative, introducing basic concepts tools life data analysis using R.

title: NA
text: WeibullR.learnr written R built using WeibullR David Silkworth Jurgen Symynck (2022), R package Weibull Analysis, learnr Garrick Aden-Buie et al. (2023), framework building interactive learning modules R. install WeibullR.learnr R: install development version:

title: NA
text: Currently, two primary learning modules exist. modules can taken either order can taken separately together. learning modules designed plug--play, changes can made forking software repository modifying fork. WeibullR.learnr() - interactive introduction Life Data Analysis (estimated duration ~2 hours) RAMR.learnr() - quick reference common Reliability, Availability, Maintainability concepts (estimated duration ~ 1 hour) modules can also accessed browser WeibullR.learnr RAMR.learnr.  Several helper functions common RAM calculations also included: rel() - reliability function avail() - availability function mttf() - mean time failure mtbf() - mean time failure serv() - serviceability factor fr() - failure rate
